instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no Image
threads.message: This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but has no image. Also nothing on an external display. I also noticed that the sleep light is on all the time (<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.4V) and that it wont chime (also no chime after NVRAM Reset). Next thing i noticed is that it also wont beep without ram installed. I checked <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> and it is 1.14V. I also tried to heat the GPU gently to ~100 °C-150 °C as this one is late 2011 but still on change. So i am stuck here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no Image
threads.message: Yeah, I would forget about this one. You can try the BIOS but that is where this one will end. CPU problems are also common on these.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no Image
threads.message:
Ok. Thank you for the answer. I looked closly to the Bios IC and it (again) looks like i am not the first one here. I can see a little bit of flux under it. So chances are good that somebody messed with the bios already and may have causet this problems.... Also GPU looks like it has seen more than one Heatgun (as everyone of this 2011 ones...). But if this turns on i will deaktivate it anyways so i would give it a try. Could you please send me a "clean bios file" for this one (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B) as you did for me with some other boards in the past?
Unfortunately i have only <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A donors here at the moment...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no Image
threads.message: It's hanging on POST. Like Duke said, forget about this one. Even if you deactivate the GPU through the EFI thing, it's still going to fail in other ways. All the EFI thing does is change gfx acceleration to the the iGPU and not the GPU. The GPU still does tons of things such as <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>LCD_EN</SIGNAL> etc..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no Image
threads.message: Just slap another BIOS chip on there from a trash board, if that works I will clean the ME for you.
